fun_fact: Periwinkles can survive out of water for several weeks by sealing themselves inside their shells using their operculum.

description: "A crustacean with a soft vulnerable abdomen that uses empty shells for protection."
habitat_info: "Crawls on top of sediments and surfaces."
fun_fact: Hermit crabs switch to bigger shells as they grow throughout their lives and are not \true\" crabs."

description: "A transparent shrimp named for its transparency but is not related to the freshwater glass shrimp."
fun_fact: Glass shrimp are nearly invisible due to their transparent bodies which help them hide from predators.

description: "A marine snail with a slipper-shaped shell."
habitat_info: "Suctions itself to surfaces like rocks or seaweed."
fun_fact: Slipper snails often form stacks where smaller males live on top of larger females.

description: "A tunicate species known for its sac-like body."
fun_fact: Sea squirts ae in the same phylum as humans- chordata.

description: "A tear-shaped bivalve commonly found in estuaries."
fun_fact: "A single oyster can filter up to 50 gallons of water per day."

description: "A resilient clam species introduced from Asia."
fun_fact: Nonnative populations have been recently identified in Boston and studies are ongoing to determine their impact on local ecosystems since Summer 2025.

description: "A small scallop species found in bays."
habitat_info: "Can burrow into sandy sediments and swim through water column."
fun_fact: Bay scallops can have up to 100 \eyes\" (photoreceptors) along the edges of their shells."

description: "A common mussel species found in New England intertidal zones."
fun_fact: Blue mussels secrete strong byssal threads that help them cling to surfaces.

habitat_info: "Likes to hide in rocky crevices or under debris and can burrow in sand."
fun_fact: Green crabs are one of the most invasive marine species in North America.

description: "A polychaete worm commonly found in marine environments."
fun_fact: Clamworms have strong jaws and can be irridescent.

description: "A polychaete worm known for its long tentacles."
habitat_info: "Burrows in sandy or muddy substrates with only tentacles visible."
fun_fact: Spaghetti worms use their delicate tentacles which have sticky mucus to filter food from the water.
